knimeNode.name: Python Edit Variable (Labs)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows execution of a Python script in a local Python installation.

fullDescription.intro: Allows execution of a Python script in a local Python installation. The path to the Python executable has to be configured in Preferences → KNIME → Python.

tab.name: Script
tab.option:
The script that will be executed to generate this nodes output. Execute script will execute the full script while execute selection will only execute the currently selected script.
The editor optionally provides autocompletion (CTRL + Space) if the Python module jedi is installed.
The list contains the available flow variables. A double click will insert the corresponding identifier at the current cursor position in the editor.
Lists the currently defined identifiers in the running Python instance. Reset workspace will remove all definitions and reinsert only the input data.
Displays the standard and error output of the execution as well as other relevant information.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Allows to choose the python version that should be used for executing the kernel. Available installations can be checked under Preferences → KNIME → Python.

Per default Int and Long columns containing missing values are converted to double in python, beacause its the only numeric type containing a builtin missing value type (NaN). The conversion may be avoided by selecting "convert missing values to sentinel value (to python)". In that case every missing value is replaced by the specified sentinel value. For the sentinel value 3 options exist. MIN_VAL represents the smallest possible value for a cloumn's datatype and MAX_VAL the correspondent largest possible value. Using the text field option an arbitrary sentinel value in Integer-range may be chosen. On the way back from python to java the sentinel values may either be replaced by missing values or left in place which is controlled through the "convert sentinel values to missing value (from python)" option.

tab.name: Templates
tab.option:
Create a new template based on the script contained in the editor of the script tab.
Note: User defined templates can be found in the folder: knime-workspace/.metadata/knime/sourcecode-templates/python-variables

Removes the selected template.
Note: Templates provided by plugins can not be removed.
Replaces the script contained in the editor of the script tab with the selected template.

ports.inPort: The input variables. In the Python script it is available as dictionary under the name flow_variables .
ports.outPort: The output variables. This is the content of the variable flow_variables after the execution of the script.

views.view: The text sent by Python to the standard output, during the execution of this node.
The text sent by Python to the error output, during the execution of this node.
